creating websites for products i didn't believe in and then i had a baby i grew up i wanted
to do some good in the world and work on products that you know were wholesome and and and good and so i joined the
public sector i joined the british council um for a better life really for for a more meaningful life
and an easier life as head of project management and their digital team doing some maternity cover but for those of
you who don't know who the british council are um it's an organization rooted in british colonial history that builds
connections understanding and trust between people in the uk and other countries through
arts and culture education in the english language it was set up in the 30s during the great depression
where there was a sort of huge drop in international trade massive falls in living standards and
high in persistent unemployment it was a time of growing threats british values prosperity and security and the economic
hardship led to extremist views nazism was on the rise across the world other countries
challenged britain's place and influence in trade and diplomacy so we needed an answer the creation of the british
council in 1934 was one way the uk government reacted to the growing threat to british interests
and today we're still governed by the uk foreign office but we've got this massive great 500
million pound turnover exams business we deliver a number of exams for a number of people including the
association of childhood certified accountants we deliver school exams
in the uk and abroad so such as gcc's and a levels internationally and our biggest business is we're kona
co-owner of ielts ielts is the most successful global english assessment test in the world
if you want to work study or migrate to a country where english is the native language you more often than not have to
sat one of our exams and it's sat by three million people globally every year
and what that does is effectively fund our core purpose which is that we connect the best of the uk
with the world and the best of the world with the uk essentially making friends around the world trying to build understanding between nations
and one example of this is shakespeare's lives which was something we did in 2016
to celebrate 400 years since his death and we did this by various initiatives
pairing uk and korean poets and artists to develop new graphic sonnets
touring british films that have reimagined his work across the globe funding and curating international dance
interpretations and another thing we did was working with chinese artists to brand a metro
train in shanghai with his work so that's just a bit about the british council but going back to what my task

ultimately we could transfer all the good stuff they had done out of that team into the wider organization that's

of shoot first don't ask forgiveness later don't don't wait
before you make the decision and challenge is good
so that's how on a monday i found myself with two other consultants part of a wider team um that antony had

our english test for our our ielts test which at this point had far too many steps
there was at least sort of 16 to 20 clicks if you really knew what you were doing
and that's before you actually booked and paid um there were
more form fields than you could ever imagine there were bespoke components we reinvented the date picker
it was over localized it was built on a monolith and releases were really infrequent like
we were releasing i don't know once every few months if we were lucky and there was no learning coming out of

so having set the foundations and strategy to deliver against that vision i had a moment i had that terrifying moment when you're like i've got

so most of the the teams i work with kick off work streams with what i call an
inception um and the reason we did this was that we had very anthony had done very

deliberately so an inception is basically um a time-bound activity in this case it was two weeks um we thought
two weeks is appropriate because this was a new team people who had never been working for the organization um people
had never met um to work together collaboratively bring some other stakeholders
into this this this team and over two weeks um align on the goals and success criteria for what we wanted
to achieve um gather as much context as we could regarding the product the business
technology infrastructure stakeholders um you know everything you needed to know to make this a success
define at a high level the future shape of this what should this be in the future and how should it look
like and then also define how we wanted to go as a team about delivering this change now
don't confuse this with waterfall um i'm not talking about big design upfront specification this is
at a much higher level and it is two weeks because there was a lot of new stuff for this team if you had an
experienced team that was in the organization already you could maybe do something like this in a day or two so it could be much shorter but this
initial activity where you bring a team together you let them align build context agree on goals build
relationships um that is super super important i've seen this so many times where this doesn't get done properly um
you'll just incur the cost later down the line um and
once completed in fact throughout this process was making we were making it highly visible we wanted the

as i said including product and change um and we decided on

change so and delivering value to the business so all these these things coming together
so change can really only come i believe from those doing the work
so the people doing the work at the grassroots level at the you know i was

build really close relationships with them including them in the process and the trick here is to build trust and
